root.name: hex()

example.code: color c = #ffcc00; println(c); // Prints -13312 println(hex(c)); // Prints FFFFCC00 println(hex(c, 6)); // Prints FFCC00
color c = color(255, 204, 0); println(c); // Prints -13312 println(hex(c)); // Prints FFFFCC00 println(hex(c, 6)); // Prints FFCC00

root.description: Converts a byte, char, int, or color to a String containing the equivalent hexadecimal notation. For example color(0, 102, 153, 255) will convert to the String "FF006699". This function can help make your geeky debugging sessions much happier.

parameter.label: value
parameter.description: byte, char, int, color: value to convert

parameter.label: digits
parameter.description: int: number of digits to return
